column4: Morning, my pc has been a bit weird over about the past 2 days, startup is taking longer and the time it takes GDM to start is considerably longer, and just now on this boot i got "filestystem has been mounted more than 30 times without being checked"
Any ideas why at all?
and you think that message has something to do with your gdm problem?
i have no idea, i mean it just hung for a few seconds while i removed openssh-server, it never did that before
open a terminal, run the command 'dmesg' and put all of the output in a pastebin
http://rafb.net/paste/results/aQI3tW59.html
it's more likely to be related to vmware than anything else
it means exactly what it says
well it was working fine till someone in here told me to stop vmware while trying to write dvds/cds
then the result of that was "non-contigous 13.1%" or something like that, it had them words
ok, i think my problems have something to do with gnomebaker and vmware
that was on my /home partition
yeah. I don't think you should worry about the drive that much.
ok, it started after i installed gnomebaker, stopped vmware, wrote a dvd, reset, started vmware
and now you're having "slowness" problems?
the gdm splash normal gets up to the third icon "nautilus" then goes now i get about 2-3 even 4 more icons, after the login screen takes around 30 seconds to come up
should i try removing gnomebaker and restart see how it goes?
worth a try. I don't use gnome or gnomebaker so I can't help that much. The message when you boot though, has nothing to do with your problem. which is useful to know
ok ill try that
no difference :(
or stop using an editor that creates files with those names
